I'm looking for the hospital shop.
Which floor has the gift shop?
Is there a place to buy cards and balloons?
Where can I purchase a gift for a patient?
Could you direct me to the souvenir shop?
Do you have a boutique on site?
How far is the gift shop from here?
Is the gift shop near the lobby?
Any shop selling stuffed animals?
Where to buy chocolates in the hospital?
Gift shop—how do I get there?
I need flowers, where's the shop?
Does the hospital have a gift store?
What's the quickest way to the gift shop?
Is the gift shop open right now?
Can visitors access the gift shop?
Which wing is the gift shop located?
Looking for a present, where's the shop?
Shop for get‑well cards location?
responses: The gift shop is on the first‑floor main lobby, opposite the reception desk.
You'll find the gift shop just past the main entrance on Level 1—look for the bright storefront with balloons.
Head to the ground floor and follow the pink signs marked ‘Gift Shop’. Volunteers can guide you if needed.
Our gift shop sits beside the cafeteria entrance on the first floor.
Take the central elevators down to Level 1; the gift shop will be on your right as you exit.
Yes—visitors are welcome. The shop is open 9 a.m.–7 p.m. daily in the main lobby.
If you’d like personal assistance, any staff member in blue vests can walk you to the gift shop.

patterns: What are the visiting hours?

When does visiting start in the morning?
Do you allow visits on weekends?
How long can we stay with a patient?
Any special visiting rules due to COVID?
Are children allowed to visit?
What time do visits end?
Please give me the visiting hours.
Is 3 p.m. okay to visit?
Can I visit after work, around 6?
Do different departments have different visiting hours?
ICU visiting policy?
Weekend visiting hours?
Are holidays different for visiting?
Can multiple people visit at once?
Is overnight stay allowed?
Need visiting hour details please.
responses: General visiting hours are 10 a.m.–8 p.m. daily, though some units have stricter rules.
Most wards welcome visitors from mid‑morning to early evening (10 a.m.–8 p.m.). Please check at the nurse’s station for unit‑specific times.
The ICU allows two visitors at a time during limited blocks—please ask ICU staff for exact slots.
Children under 12 may have restrictions; speak with the charge nurse before bringing young visitors.
During flu/COVID season, hours or visitor numbers may change. We recommend confirming with the ward before you arrive.
If you need to visit outside standard times for special reasons, please discuss with the patient’s nurse.
On holidays and weekends, hours usually remain 10 a.m.–8 p.m., but it’s best to call ahead to verify.

patterns: Where can I park?
Is there visitor parking?
Parking garage location?

Do you validate parking tickets?
Is there free parking for patients?
Can I park overnight?
Where is disabled parking?
How long is the walk from parking to the entrance?
Any valet service available?
Parking lot hours?
Is the parking structure full right now?
Where do I pay for parking?
Do you have electric vehicle charging stations?
Are motorcycles allowed in the garage?
What's the daily parking rate?
Is street parking an option near the hospital?
How do I get parking validated?
Where is the parking kiosk?
Is parking close to the emergency entrance?
Can I leave and come back on the same ticket?
Which lot is best for maternity visitors?
Parking fee for first hour?
Do volunteers get free parking?
responses: Visitor parking is located in Garage A next to the main entrance; follow the blue ‘Parking’ signs.
Standard parking is $3 per hour, capped at $12 per day. Pay at the kiosks before exiting.
We validate tickets for outpatient procedures—present your ticket at the clinic desk for a discount.
Accessible (disabled) parking spots are available on every level near the elevators in Garage A.
Valet service is offered weekdays 7 a.m.–6 p.m. at the main entrance for a flat $5 fee plus parking.
Overnight parking is allowed; please notify Security if you plan to leave your car past midnight.
Electric vehicle charging stations are located on Level 2 of the garage—standard parking fees apply.

patterns: Is the hospital wheelchair accessible?
Where can I borrow a wheelchair?
Do you have ramps at the entrances?
I need wheelchair access—help?
Are wheelchairs available for visitors?
Where is the nearest accessible restroom?
Is there an elevator close by?
Can I reserve a wheelchair in advance?
Entrance for wheelchair users?
How do I get to Radiology with a wheelchair?
Is the parking garage accessible?
Are there automatic doors at the front?
Do you loan wheelchairs for free?
Can staff assist with mobility?
Is there a lift to the cafeteria?
Where are the wheelchair ramps?
Wheelchair friendly paths?
Are patient rooms wide enough for wheelchairs?
Accessibility services contact?
Where return wheelchair after use?
Can I get a mobility scooter instead?
Where is the ADA entrance?
Does the hospital meet ADA standards?
Help me find an accessible route.
responses: All main entrances have ramps and automatic doors for wheelchair access.
Free wheelchairs are available at the information desk in the main lobby—please present a photo ID.
Elevators are located next to each main entrance and are sized for wheelchairs and mobility scooters.
Accessible restrooms are on every floor near the central elevators; look for the wheelchair symbol.
If you need assistance, our transport team can escort you—just ask at the front desk or press the help button on any courtesy phone.
Garage A includes accessible parking spots near the elevators. From there, a covered ramp leads to the main lobby.
When you’re finished, you can return the wheelchair to any marked drop‑off zone or the information desk.

patterns: I lost my phone—where do I check?
Is there a lost and found?
How do I report a lost item?
Where can I pick up something I left behind?
Did anyone turn in a wallet?
Lost property office location?
I think I dropped my keys—help!
Who do I call for lost items?
Where to go for missing belongings?
Is Security handling lost and found?
Can you check if my necklace was found?
How long do you keep lost items?
Where is the lost and found desk?
I left my jacket in ICU—what now?
Found something—where do I turn it in?
Do you log lost items online?
Pickup hours for lost property?
Can you track a missing hearing aid?
Lost and found phone number?
My child lost her toy—where to ask?
Is there a form to report lost items?
How soon should I report a lost item?
Any chance my umbrella was found?
Who is in charge of lost belongings?
responses: Our Security Office manages lost and found and is located on the ground floor near the east entrance.
You can report or claim items weekdays 8 a.m.–6 p.m. at the Security window or by calling extension 5555.
To check on a lost item, please provide a detailed description; Security logs all items for 30 days.
If you found something, turn it in at any nursing station or directly at the Security Office.
After regular hours, Security dispatch can still assist—use the courtesy phone in the lobby.
Small valuable items like jewelry or phones are stored securely in the vault until claimed.
Unclaimed items are donated after 30 days, so please reach out as soon as possible.
